questions: What is Critical Illness Insurance?
answers: A critical illness cover is an insurance which pays you a lump-sum amount if diagnosed with a covered critical illness under the Policy.

questions: Do I need Critical Illness insurance if I have a Health Insurance cover?
answers: Yes, a health insurance policy will cover your hospitalization expenses and other related medical expenditure, however in case of a critical illness you may need much more than that. The treatment can be long and ongoing which may need more monetary support. You may even not be able to work and the lump sum amount can shield you against such a financial burden.

questions: What does this plan cover?
answers: This policy covers 20, 50 and 64 Critical illness under Plan 1, 2 and 3 respectively. Plan 1 and 2 provide 100% of Sum Insured on diagnosis of a covered Critical illness. The payout under Plan 3 can be a maximum up to 150% of Sum Insured. You can also opt for coverage under Second E opinion and wellness coach where experts guide you on a path of your health journey.

questions: What is the claim amount you are insured for under the three plans?
answers:
Plan 1 – you can claim up to 100% of the Sum Insured for the 20 CI’s covered

Plan 2 – you can claim up to 100% of the Sum Insured for the 50 CI’s covered

Plan 3 -  you can claim up to 50%, max up to 10 Lacs of the Sum Insured for the 14 Critical illnesses covered in List B (post which the cover doesn’t terminate) & 100% of the Sum Insured for the 50 CI’s covered in List A. Please refer to the terms of the policy for more details.

questions: In case I opt for Plan 3, how many claims be made?
answers: Yes, you can claim once under List B and once under List A. However, once a claim is made under list A first then the policy will terminate

questions: Is there survival period?
answers: Yes, you have to survive a minimum of 15 days post the diagnosis to get the claim.

questions: Are there any optional covers under the plan?
answers: Yes, you can opt for a Second E-opinion where you can take a second opinion on the critical illness from a panel of medical practitioners. You can also opt for a Wellness coach which is an expert that will guide you on the path of good health by advise on fitness, nutrition and more.

questions: Is there an age limit for opting for a Critical Illness plan?
answers: The minimum entry age is 5 years for Plan 1 and Plan 2 and 18 years for Plan 3.  The maximum entry age is 65 years.

questions: What is the basis of determining the sum insured under Critical illness plan?
answers: Your income is a determining factor for your sum insured. For more details, please consult your sales advisor.

questions: Will I be able to cover my non-earning spouse, children and parents under the policy?
answers:
Yes, your non-earning children and parents are eligible for the below Sum Insured’s

  1. Non-earning Spouse– 50% of Proposer’s sum insured/eligibility or 30L whichever is lower.
  2. Non-earning Parent/ Parent in laws – 50% of Proposer’s sum insured/eligibility or 10L whichever is lower.
  3. Children/Student – 50% of Proposer’s sum insured/eligibility or 15L whichever is lower.

questions: How long is my Policy valid for?
answers: We offer you an option of buying our health policy for 1 year, 2 years and 3 years’ term. You can renew your policy at the end of policy term.

questions: Will I get a discount on a 2 or a 3-year policy tenure?
answers: A long term discount of 7.5% and 10% on premium is applicable on selecting a policy terms of 2 and 3 years respectively. This will apply only in case of Single Premium Policies.

questions: Until what age can I renew my Policy?
answers: We offer lifetime renewability for this health plan, subject to payment of premium and fulfilment of other policy conditions.

questions: Can I increase my Sum insured?
answers: Yes, you can request for enhancement of Sum insured at the time of renewal. However, the enhancement is subject to underwriting decision.

questions: What are the premium payment options under this policy?
answers: You can choose to buy Policy by paying single premium or You can choose premium payment on instalment basis. Monthly/quarterly/semi-annual instalment options are available for Policies with Policy Period of 1 year.

questions: Is there a cashless facility under Critical illness plan?
answers: There is no cashless facility under this cover as we make lump sum payment up to the sum insured. The received amount can be used by You for any hospitalization/ other expenses.

questions: Is there a death benefit under this plan?
answers: On first diagnosis of the covered critical illness, we will a lump sum amount of sum insured. There is no death benefit provided

questions: How should I claim benefit under the Critical Illness plan?
answers:
You need to submit the following documents to us within 30 days of occurrence of the event:

  • Completed Claim form
  • Medical certificate confirming the diagnosis of Critical Illness
  • Certificate confirming that the claim doesn’t relate to Pre-Existing Disease or any Illness/ Injury which was diagnosed within the first 90 days  
  • Photocopy of indoor case papers (if applicable)
  • In the cases where Critical Illness arises due to an Accident, FIR copy or medico legal certificate
  • Specific documents (if any) listed under the respective Critical Illness

questions: Who can I purchase the policy for?
answers: You can purchase the policy for yourself and include your spouse up to four children, and yours and your spouse’s parents.

questions: I want to cover my 4 family members. Do I get any discounts?
answers: You can avail a discount of 10% on premium on covering 2 or more family members in a single policy.

questions: Is there an age limit for opting for a Critical Illness plan?
answers: The minimum entry age is 5 years and the maximum entry age is 65 years.
